content: two needles start on one side of bag and let the stiches on the other side rest starting on the first side rs work back and forth in stockinette stitch across the 24 36 48 stitches until the piece measures approximately 11 5 14 5 25 cm for neat edges slip the first stitch of each row knit-wise on the rs and purl- wise on the ws you want to make sure the free flap is large enough to fold over and that a drawstring can be pulled through end on a ws and cast-off on a rs work a folded hem by either casting off and securing the cast-off edge down to the inside of the bag whip stitch or working a fold and knit bind-off fold and knit bind-off https //www youtube com/watch v=ug5an5byme8 work the other side of the bag the same way slip the resting stitches onto live needles and work a folded hem as stated above drawstrings using a 2 5mm crochet hook make a simple chain long enough to pull through both folded hems of the bag it should be a little longer than twice the width of the bag see picture to the left make two chains of the same length you can also choose a different cord or ribbon for the drawstring if you please make sure they are the same length and can fit through the folded hem with ease to insert the drawstrings using a tapestry needle and starting with the front folded hem closest to you work the drawstring through the left-side opening out through to the ride-side opening without pulling the whole string through work it through the right-side opening of the back hem through to the left-side opening 2 back 3 2 1 front work the second drawstring in the opposite direction starting with the front hem closest to you working the tapestry needle with the drawstring through the right-side opening through to the left-side opening without pulling the whole string through work it through the left-side opening of the back hem through to the right-side opening back 3 2 1 front secure the drawstrings together on each side by tying the ends together into a simple knot weave in all loose ends wash and block as needed sew in a lining if needed if you decide to insert a lining make sure to sew it in at the point where the folded hem is secured as pictured below i whip stitched my lining just over the bottom of the folded hem so it covers the seam this is a free pattern and is for personal use it has not been tested or tech edited it is solely something i wanted to share with you all please share your versions on ravelry and/or instagram with #thescrapbag and tag me because i would love to see them i am on instagram and ravelry @shecraftslove if you
